description: Conversion of detached two-storey dwellinghouse into two (2) self-contained residential flats; first floor rear/side extension; loft floor rear roof terrace; associated external and internal works including new ground floor side door entrance, ground floor side window and parapet wall; front boundary wall infill; provision of cycle store and refuse area
decision_conditions: The development to which this permission relates shall be begun not later than the expiration of three years from the date of this permission.
Reason: To comply with Section 91 of the Town & Country Planning Act 1990. | The development hereby approved shall be carried out in accordance with the following drawings:
Existing/Proposed Block Plans Rev 1;
Proposed Ground Floor Plan Rev 2;
Proposed First Floor Plan Rev 2;
Proposed Loft Floor Plan Rev 1;
Proposed Front/Rear Elevations Rev 1;
Proposed Side Elevations Rev 4;
Proposed Street Scene Rev 1.
Reason: For the avoidance of doubt, and in the interests of proper planning.

| All external materials to be used in the development shall match the appearance of those of the existing building, unless otherwise stated in the submitted application form or approved drawings listed under condition 2.

Reason: To ensure that the materials harmonise with the surroundings, in accordance with policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Core Strategy (2012), policies 7.4, 7B and 7C of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies D3, D4 and HC1 of the London Plan (2021) and policy DAA of Ealing's draft Local Plan (Regulation 18). | Prior to use of the loft floor rear roof terrace hereby approved, the privacy screening identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 shall be installed. The privacy screen shall be retained for the lifetime of the development.

Other than the loft floor rear roof terrace identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2, no part of the roof shall be used as or altered to form a balcony, roof garden, roof terrace or similar amenity area.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy DAA of Ealing's draft Local Plan (Regulation 18).

| The bicycle store identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved flats and shall be permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To provide adequate cycle storage facilities for future occupiers in accordance with policy T5 of the London Plan (2021).

| The refuse and recycling storage area identified in the approved drawings listed under condition 2 shall be brought into use prior to the first occupation of the hereby approved flats and shall be permanently retained for the lifetime of the development.
Reason: To provide adequate refuse facilities for future occupiers in accordance with policy SI 7 of the London Plan (2021).

| The proposed ground floor side elevational window serving a bathroom of the hereby approved development shall contain only obscured glass, below a minimum height of 1.7 metres (5'7") above the relevant floor level.

Reason: To protect the living conditions of neighbouring properties in accordance with policy 7B of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013) and policy DAA of Ealing's draft Local Plan (Regulation 18).

| Prior to commencement of the development, details shall be submitted to the Council for approval in writing, of an enhanced sound insulation value of at least 5dB above the maximum Building Regulations value, for the floor/ceiling/wall structures separating different types of rooms/uses in adjoining dwellings/areas, namely, bedrooms below toilet and above reception room of separate dwelling. The assessment and mitigation measures shall have regard to standards of the Council's SPG10 and noise limits specified in BS8233:2014. Approved details shall be implemented prior to occupation of the development and thereafter be permanently retained.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of the development site is not adversely affected by noise in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policies 1.1 and 1.2 of the Ealing Development (Core) Strategy (2012), policies D6 and D14 of the London Plan (2021) and the NPPF (2023).
|  During the implementation of the development hereby approved, control measures shall ensure that the following standards and requirements are implemented and adhered to:
o noise and vibration (according to Approved CoP BS 5228-1 and -2:2009+A1:2014),
o dust (according to Supplementary Planning Guidance by the GLA (2014) for The Control of Dust and Emissions during Construction and Demolition),
o lighting ('Guidance Note 01/20 For The Reduction Of Obtrusive Light' by the Institution of Lighting Professionals),
o hours of work and all associated activities audible beyond the site boundary restricted to 0800-1800hrs Mondays to Fridays, 0800 -1300 Saturdays (no work on public holidays),
o neighbour liaison, notifications to interested parties and considerate complaints procedure,
o public display of contact details including accessible phone numbers for persons responsible for the work for the duration of the works in case of emergencies, enquiries or complaints.

Reason: To ensure that the amenity of occupiers of surrounding premises is not adversely affected by noise, vibration, dust, lighting or other emissions from the site, in accordance with policy 7A of the Ealing Development Management DPD (2013), policy D14 of the London Plan 2021, the Greater London Authority Best Practice Guidance 'The Control of Dust and Emissions from Construction and Demolition (2006), and BS 5228-1:2009 - Code of practice for noise & vibration control on construction & open sites-Part 1: Noise density.
